pr_title: Adding RFC links for standardised HttpHeaderNames constants in javadoc

timeline.message: link for connection header name: RFC7230, section 6.1
RFC link for content-encoding  header name: RFC7231, section 3.1.2.2
RFC link for content-length  header name: RFC7230, section 3.3.2
RFC links in javadoc for header names constants

timeline.author: idelpivnitskiy

timeline.bodyText: Please, remove unnecessary space before closing tag RFC6266_
timeline.author: idelpivnitskiy

timeline.bodyText: Consider adding a link for https://www.w3.org/TR/CSP3/#csp-header
timeline.author: idelpivnitskiy

timeline.bodyText: While you are here, could you align javadoc for this header to follow a consistent format: {@code "forwarded"} is a header field that ... ... @see RFC7239, section 4 Please, also adjust X_FORWARDED_FOR, X_FORWARDED_HOST, and X_FORWARDED_PROTO constant. to use the same format.
timeline.author: idelpivnitskiy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -180,70 +233,104 @@
     public static final CharSequence FORWARDED = newAsciiString("forwarded");

timeline.bodyText: Please, remove unnecessary space before closing tag 5.5 _
timeline.author: idelpivnitskiy

timeline.bodyText: Looks like a missed link to https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7235#section-4.1
timeline.author: idelpivnitskiy

timeline.message: RFC link for www-authenticate http header name constant
javadoc updated for x-forwarded-for, x-forwarded-host, x-forwarded-proto, forwarded
